Main BIOS Settings

Figure 7-12 Main

Table 7-5 Main BIOS Parameters

Field Name

Description

Quiet Boot

The BIOS displays any one of the following during Power On Self-Test (POST).

 • disabled - Displays all messages and option ROM information during boot.

 • enabled - Displays the logo screen, and no messages or Option ROM information during boot.

 • Platform Default - Displays the attribute values in the BIOS defaults for the server type and vendor.

Front Panel Lockout

Select the mode of configuration to connect the device.

Post Error Pause

When a server encounters any critical error during POST. The following are displayed.:

 • disabled—The BIOS boots the server without warning any error message.

 • enabled—The BIOS throws an error message when a critical error occurs.

 • Platform Default—The BIOS uses the attribute values in the BIOS for the server type and vendor.

Reboot on BIOS Settings Change

Select this option to reboot the server when BIOS settings are modified, and apply the changes.

Resume AC on Power Loss

When there is an unexpected power loss, power is restored depending on the following values:

 • stay-off - the server is switched off until power is manually on.

 • last-state - the server is powered on and the system attempts to restore its last state.

 • reset - the server is powered on and automatically resets.

 • Platform Default -The BIOS uses the attribute values in the BIOS defaults for the server type and vendor.
